pullRequest.body:
Yet another small step toward Jordan-Chevalley-Dunford.

This was far more work than expected, partly because of missing API for `Squarefree`, and partly because the definition `IsCoprime` is the wrong concept for unique factorization domains.

---



[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

LGTM. The UFD proofs are on the longer side, but it sounds like there's an incoming refactor anyways, so I think we shouldn't spend too much energy on optimizing them.

bors d+

LGTM. The UFD proofs are on the longer side, but it sounds like there's an incoming refactor anyways, so I think we shouldn't spend too much energy on optimizing them.

bors d+
Can this be simplified by having a lemma saying that if `p ^ k | x * y`, then there exist `i, j` with `i + j = k` such that `p ^ i | x` and `p ^ j | y`?

Such a lemma would indeed shorten this proof (and it is worth having) but it is a moderate amount of work.

Inspired by this remark I have however pushed a golf which cuts away more than half of this proof: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/10170/commits/27cdca5d4b42c4e383ffa2a7ab4b39de92027d55

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: a polynomial over a perfect field is separable iff it is square-free
